Authors: Aries, Vional, Saraswati L.A., Wijaya L., Ikhsan R.B.
Title: Gamification in learning process and its impact on entrepreneurial intention
Affiliations: Management Department, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Aries, Management Department, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Vional, Management Department, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Saraswati, L.A., Management Department, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Wijaya, L., Management Department, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Ikhsan, R.B., Management Department, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: Gamification is an educational approach to motivate and influence students’ behaviors in learning with the intention of achieving learning outcomes. The primary objective of the study is to examine students’ intentions to become entrepreneurs as an impact of gamification model learning in Entrepreneurship or Business Plan courses in BINUS ONLINE Learning. Data collection was carried out for 400 students who took Entrepreneurship and Business Plan courses for 1 month using questionnaires. The data was then analyzed using multiple linear regression approach. The result shows that attitude towards behavior (ATB), perceived behavior control (PBS), and subjective norms partially give positive impacts and they are significant to entrepreneurial intentions. Perceived behavioral control (PBC) is the dominant factor in forming entrepreneurial intentions for students. © 2020 by the authors
Author Keywords: Entrepreneurial Intentions; Long Distance Learning Program; Planned Behavior

Authors: Ikhsan R.B., Saraswati L.A., Muchardie B.G., Vional, Susilo A.
Title: The determinants of students' perceived learning outcomes and satisfaction in BINUS online learning
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 5th International Conference on New Media Studies, CONMEDIA 2019
Affiliations: BINUS ONLINE Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Ikhsan, R.B., BINUS ONLINE Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Saraswati, L.A., BINUS ONLINE Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Muchardie, B.G., BINUS ONLINE Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Vional, BINUS ONLINE Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Susilo, A., BINUS ONLINE Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The advancement of information technology and communication and the changing in education paradigm have influenced the process and method of learning. Online learning is one of the innovations for this recent changing paradigm. In this study, Structural Equation Modelling (SEM) is applied to examine the determinants of students' perceived learning outcomes and satisfaction in the context of university online course. Independent variables include instructor facilitation, technical support, course structure, instructor feedback, self-motivation, peer support, and interaction as potential determinants of online learning. A total of 400 BINUS Online Learning students were surveyed. The structural model result reveals that instructor facilitation, technical support, instructor feedback, and self-motivation affect the learning outcomes, and instructor facilitation, technical support, self-motivation, and peer support significantly affect the students' satisfaction. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Learning outcomes; Online learning; Students' perception; Students' satisfaction
Index Keywords: Education computing; Learning systems; Motivation; Students; Independent variables; Information technology and communications; Method of learning; Perceived learning outcomes; Structural equation modelling (SEM); Structural modeling; Students' satisfaction; Technical support; E-learning

Title: Adoption of E-Commerce Online to Offline with Technology Acceptance Model (TAM) Approach
Source title: 2018 4th International Conference on Computer and Information Sciences: Revolutionising Digital Landscape for Sustainable Smart Society, ICCOINS 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: International Marketing Program, Management Department, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Management Department, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Riantini, R.E., International Marketing Program, Management Department, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Vional, Management Department, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Aries, Management Department, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: One application of technology in business activities is E-Commerce and the number of E-Commerce users led to the emergence of various types of E-Commerce. One type of E-Commerce that is currently a concern is E-Commerce Online to Offline (O2O). O2O services can be an alternative solution in the distribution of goods for retail companies in Indonesia that implement e-commerce services. Research in the field of E-Commerce adoption has done a lot of previous researchers with model Technology Acceptance Model (TAM). This research will discuss how the adoption of Jakarta Retailer Customer in using E-Commerce Online to Offline service. The purpose of this research is to know the characteristics of customers of shopping online retail sites in Jakarta and to know what variables of Technology Acceptance Model (TAM) affect the adoption of O2O E-Commerce customers in Jakarta. Hypothesis testing proposed in the study using SEM or Stuctural Equation Modeling analysis operated through AMOS program to 111 Respondents. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: E-Commerce Online to Offline; Perceived Risk; Stuctural Equation Modeling; Technology Acceptance Model
Index Keywords: Electronic commerce; Sales; Software testing; Alternative solutions; Business activities; Equation models; Modeling technology; Offline; Online retail sites; Perceived risk; Technology acceptance model; Distribution of goods

Authors: Ikhsan R.B., Prabowo H., Wiharja C.K., Vional
Title: Customer retention as a result of behavioural intention: Relationship between customer orientation of service employee and service quality
Source title: Pertanika Journal of Social Sciences and Humanities
Affiliations: Management Department, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Kampus Syahdan, Jakarta Barat, 11480, Indonesia; Computer Science Department, Language Center, Bina Nusantara University Kemanggisan/Palmerah, Jakarta Barat, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Ikhsan, R.B., Management Department, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Kampus Syahdan, Jakarta Barat, 11480, Indonesia; Prabowo, H., Management Department, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Kampus Syahdan, Jakarta Barat, 11480, Indonesia; Wiharja, C.K., Computer Science Department, Language Center, Bina Nusantara University Kemanggisan/Palmerah, Jakarta Barat, 11480, Indonesia; Vional, Management Department, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Kampus Syahdan, Jakarta Barat, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The purpose of this research is to understand the impact of Customer Orientation of Service Employee (COSE) and the quality of services provided in order to determine the customer’s behavioural retention motives in the banking industry at Lampung Province. A survey was conducted among 400 customers of commercial banks in Lampung for two months (June - August 2016) with proportional distribution. Survey data was analysed using Structural Equation Modelling (SEM) based on Lisrel 8.71. The findings show the customer’s behavior towards banking services determine whether the latter will be retained based on its quality of service and if it is customer-oriented. Overall, the findings suggest that it is important to study the intention of consumer behavior to face competition in banking industry. For further research, it is recommended to research in the areas of customer satisfaction and other relevant variables to expand the research area. © Universiti Putra Malaysia Press.
Author Keywords: Banking; Behavioural intention; Customer orientation; Customer retention; Service quality
